  14. (**************************************************************************)

  16. (** Unicode characters.

  18.     @since 4.03 *)

  20. ‌type t
  21. [@@immediate]
  22. (** The type for Unicode characters.

  24.     A value of this type represents a Unicode
  25.     {{:http://unicode.org/glossary/#unicode_scalar_value}scalar
  26.     value} which is an integer in the ranges [0x0000]...[0xD7FF] or
  27.     [0xE000]...[0x10FFFF]. *)

  29. ‌val min : t
  30. (** [min] is U+0000. *)

  32. ‌val max : t
  33. (** [max] is U+10FFFF. *)

  35. ‌val bom : t
  36. (** [bom] is U+FEFF, the
  37.     {{:http://unicode.org/glossary/#byte_order_mark}byte order mark} (BOM)
  38.     character.

  40.     @since 4.06 *)

  42. ‌val rep : t
  43. (** [rep] is U+FFFD, the
  44.     {{:http://unicode.org/glossary/#replacement_character}replacement}
  45.     character.

  47.     @since 4.06 *)

  49. ‌val succ : t -> t
  50. (** [succ u] is the scalar value after [u] in the set of Unicode scalar
  51.     values.

  53.     @raise Invalid_argument if [u] is {!max}. *)

  55. ‌val pred : t -> t
  56. (** [pred u] is the scalar value before [u] in the set of Unicode scalar
  57.     values.

  59.     @raise Invalid_argument if [u] is {!min}. *)

  61. ‌val is_valid : int -> bool
  62. (** [is_valid n] is [true] if and only if [n] is a Unicode scalar value
  63.     (i.e. in the ranges [0x0000]...[0xD7FF] or [0xE000]...[0x10FFFF]).*)

  65. ‌val of_int : int -> t
  66. (** [of_int i] is [i] as a Unicode character.

  68.     @raise Invalid_argument if [i] does not satisfy {!is_valid}. *)

  70. (**/**)
  71. ‌val unsafe_of_int : int -> t
  72. (**/**)

  74. ‌val to_int : t -> int
  75. (** [to_int u] is [u] as an integer. *)

  77. ‌val is_char : t -> bool
  78. (** [is_char u] is [true] if and only if [u] is a latin1 OCaml character. *)

  80. ‌val of_char : char -> t
  81. (** [of_char c] is [c] as a Unicode character. *)

  83. ‌val to_char : t -> char
  84. (** [to_char u] is [u] as an OCaml latin1 character.

  86.     @raise Invalid_argument if [u] does not satisfy {!is_char}. *)

  88. (**/**)
  89. ‌val unsafe_to_char : t -> char
  90. (**/**)

  92. ‌val equal : t -> t -> bool
  93. (** [equal u u'] is [u = u']. *)

  95. ‌val compare : t -> t -> int
  96. (** [compare u u'] is [Stdlib.compare u u']. *)

  98. ‌val hash : t -> int
  99. (** [hash u] associates a non-negative integer to [u]. *)

  101. (** {1:utf UTF codecs tools}

  103.     @since 4.14 *)

  105. ‌type utf_decode [@@immediate]
  106. (** The type for UTF decode results. Values of this type represent
  107.     the result of a Unicode Transformation Format decoding attempt. *)

  109. ‌val utf_decode_is_valid : utf_decode -> bool
  110. (** [utf_decode_is_valid d] is [true] if and only if [d] holds a valid
  111.     decode. *)

  113. ‌val utf_decode_uchar : utf_decode -> t
  114. (** [utf_decode_uchar d] is the Unicode character decoded by [d] if
  115.     [utf_decode_is_valid d] is [true] and {!Uchar.rep} otherwise. *)

  117. ‌val utf_decode_length : utf_decode -> int
  118. (** [utf_decode_length d] is the number of elements from the source
  119.     that were consumed by the decode [d]. This is always strictly
  120.     positive and smaller or equal to [4]. The kind of source elements
  121.     depends on the actual decoder; for the decoders of the standard
  122.     library this function always returns a length in bytes. *)

  124. ‌val utf_decode : int -> t -> utf_decode
  125. (** [utf_decode n u] is a valid UTF decode for [u] that consumed [n]
  126.     elements from the source for decoding. [n] must be positive and
  127.     smaller or equal to [4] (this is not checked by the module). *)

  129. ‌val utf_decode_invalid : int -> utf_decode
  130. (** [utf_decode_invalid n] is an invalid UTF decode that consumed [n]
  131.     elements from the source to error. [n] must be positive and
  132.     smaller or equal to [4] (this is not checked by the module). The
  133.     resulting decode has {!rep} as the decoded Unicode character. *)

  135. ‌val utf_8_byte_length : t -> int
  136. (** [utf_8_byte_length u] is the number of bytes needed to encode
  137.     [u] in UTF-8. *)

  139. ‌val utf_16_byte_length : t -> int
  140. (** [utf_16_byte_length u] is the number of bytes needed to encode
  141.     [u] in UTF-16. *)
